00028 IOMux::IOMux(const bool B_AutoDelete)
00029   : IODevice("mux", "\n", B_AutoDelete),
00030     m_bIOLocked(false)
00031 {
00032     EnsureCommonDevices();
00033     EnsureTraces();
00034 
00035     memset(m_arpcliOutputs, '\0', sizeof(m_arpcliOutputs));
00036 }
00037 
00038 IOMux::~IOMux(void)
00039 {
00040     for (int i = 0; i < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT; i++)
00041     {
00042         SetOutput((STREAM_TYPE) i, NULL);
00043     }
00044     ResetInputList();
00045 }
00046 
00047 const bool IOMux::OpenDevice(void)
00048 {
00049     bool b_Res = true;
00050     IODevice* pcli_Input = NULL;
00051 
00052     // Input.
00053     if ((! CheckInput()) || (m_qInputs.empty()))
00054     {
00055         b_Res = false;
00056     }
00057     else
00058     {
00059         if ((pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front()))
00060         {
00061             if (! pcli_Input->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00062             {
00063                 b_Res = false;
00064             }
00065         }
00066         else
00067         {
00068             b_Res = false;
00069         }
00070     }
00071 
00072     // Outputs.
00073     for (int i = 0; i < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT; i++)
00074     {
00075         // Select default output if none is set.
00076         if (m_arpcliOutputs[i] == NULL)
00077         {
00078             if (pcli_Input != NULL)
00079             {
00080                 m_arpcliOutputs[i] = pcli_Input;
00081             }
00082             else
00083             {
00084                 m_arpcliOutputs[i] = & OutputDevice::GetNullDevice();
00085             }
00086             m_arpcliOutputs[i]->UseInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00087         }
00088 
00089         // Open up the output device.
00090         if (m_arpcliOutputs[i] != NULL)
00091         {
00092             if (! m_arpcliOutputs[i]->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00093             {
00094                 b_Res = false;
00095             }
00096         }
00097     }
00098 
00099     if (! b_Res)
00100     {
00101         CloseDevice();
00102     }
00103     return b_Res;
00104 }
00105 
00106 const bool IOMux::CloseDevice(void)
00107 {
00108     bool b_Res = true;
00109 
00110     // Outputs.
00111     for (int i = 0; i < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT; i++)
00112     {
00113         if (m_arpcliOutputs[i] != NULL)
00114         {
00115             if (! m_arpcliOutputs[i]->CloseDown(__CALL_INFO__))
00116             {
00117                 b_Res = false;
00118             }
00119         }
00120     }
00121 
00122     // Inputs.
00123     while (! m_qInputs.empty())
00124     {
00125         if (! ReleaseFirstInputDevice())
00126         {
00127             b_Res = false;
00128         }
00129     }
00130 
00131     return b_Res;
00132 }
00133 
00134 void IOMux::PutString(const std::string& STR_Out) const
00135 {
00137     if ((m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM] != NULL)
00138         // Protection against infinite loop.
00139         && (! m_bIOLocked))
00140     {
00141         m_bIOLocked = true;
00142         m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM]->PutString(STR_Out);
00143         m_bIOLocked = false;
00144     }
00145 }
00146 
00147 void IOMux::Beep(void) const
00148 {
00150     if ((m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM] != NULL)
00151         // Protection against infinite loop.
00152         && (! m_bIOLocked))
00153     {
00154         m_bIOLocked = true;
00155         m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM]->Beep();
00156         m_bIOLocked = false;
00157     }
00158 }
00159 
00160 const KEY IOMux::GetKey(void) const
00161 {
00162     if (CheckInput() && (! m_qInputs.empty()))
00163     {
00164         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front())
00165         {
00166             // Protection against infinite loop.
00167             if (! m_bIOLocked)
00168             {
00169                 m_bIOLocked = true;
00170                 KEY e_Key = pcli_Input->GetKey();
00171                 m_bIOLocked = false;
00172 
00173                 if (e_Key != NULL_KEY)
00174                 {
00175                     return e_Key;
00176                 }
00177                 else if (const_cast<IOMux*>(this)->NextInput())
00178                 {
00179                     return GetKey();
00180                 }
00181             }
00182         }
00183     }
00184 
00185     return cli::NULL_KEY;
00186 }
00187 
00188 const OutputDevice& IOMux::GetOutput(const STREAM_TYPE E_StreamType) const
00189 {
00190     if ((E_StreamType >= 0) && (E_StreamType < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT)
00191         && (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != NULL))
00192     {
00193         return *m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType];
00194     }
00195     else
00196     {
00197         return OutputDevice::GetNullDevice();
00198     }
00199 }
00200 
00201 const bool IOMux::SetOutput(const STREAM_TYPE E_StreamType, OutputDevice* const PCLI_Stream)
00202 {
00203     // Free previous device.
00204     if (! ReleaseOutputDevice(E_StreamType, true))
00205     {
00206         return false;
00207     }
00208 
00209     // Store next device reference.
00210     m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] = PCLI_Stream;
00211     // Lock the device instance.
00212     if (PCLI_Stream != NULL)
00213     {
00214         PCLI_Stream->UseInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00215     }
00216 
00217     // Possibly open the device.
00218     if ((GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00219         && (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != NULL)
00220         // Protection against misfunctionning.
00221         && (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != this))
00222     {
00223         if (! m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType]->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00224         {
00225             return false;
00226         }
00227     }
00228 
00229     return true;
00230 }
00231 
00232 const IODevice* const IOMux::GetInput(void) const
00233 {
00234     if (! m_qInputs.empty())
00235     {
00236         return m_qInputs.front();
00237     }
00238 
00239     return NULL;
00240 }
00241 
00242 const bool IOMux::AddInput(IODevice* const PCLI_Input)
00243 {
00244     if (PCLI_Input != NULL)
00245     {
00246         m_qInputs.push_back(PCLI_Input);
00247         PCLI_Input->UseInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00248     }
00249 
00250     return true;
00251 }
00252 
00253 const bool IOMux::NextInput(void)
00254 {
00255     // Terminate head device.
00256     if (! m_qInputs.empty())
00257     {
00258         if (! ReleaseFirstInputDevice())
00259         {
00260             return false;
00261         }
00262     }
00263 
00264     // Prepare next device.
00265     if (CheckInput() && (! m_qInputs.empty()))
00266     {
00267         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front())
00268         {
00269             if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00270             {
00271                 if (! pcli_Input->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00272                 {
00273                     // Open failure.
00274                     return false;
00275                 }
00276             }
00277 
00278             // Successful return.
00279             return true;
00280         }
00281     }
00282 
00283     // Default return indicates a failure.
00284     return false;
00285 }
00286 
00287 const bool IOMux::ResetInputList(void)
00288 {
00289     bool b_Res = true;
00290 
00291     while (! m_qInputs.empty())
00292     {
00293         if (! ReleaseFirstInputDevice())
00294         {
00295             b_Res = false;
00296         }
00297     }
00298 
00299     return b_Res;
00300 }
00301 
00302 IODevice* const IOMux::CreateInputDevice(void)
00303 {
00304     return NULL;
00305 }
00306 
00307 const bool IOMux::CheckInput(void) const
00308 {
00309     if (m_qInputs.empty())
00310     {
00311         // Input needed.
00312         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = const_cast<IOMux*>(this)->CreateInputDevice())
00313         {
00314             const_cast<IOMux*>(this)->AddInput(pcli_Input);
00315             if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00316             {
00317                 // Input should be opened.
00318                 if (! pcli_Input->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00319                 {
00320                     // Open failure.
00321                     return false;
00322                 }
00323             }
00324         }
00325         else if (m_qInputs.empty())
00326         {
00327             // No more input.
00328             return false;
00329         }
00330     }
00331 
00332     // Successful return.
00333     return true;
00334 }
00335 
00336 const bool IOMux::ReleaseFirstInputDevice(void)
00337 {
00338     if (! m_qInputs.empty())
00339     {
00340         bool b_Res = true;
00341 
00342         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front())
00343         {
00344             if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00345             {
00346                 // Close the device if needed.
00347                 if (! pcli_Input->CloseDown(__CALL_INFO__))
00348                 {
00349                     b_Res = false;
00350                 }
00351             }
00352             // Free the device instance.
00353             pcli_Input->FreeInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00354         }
00355 
00356         // Remove device reference.
00357         m_qInputs.pop_front();
00358 
00359         return b_Res;
00360     }
00361     else
00362     {
00363         return false;
00364     }
00365 }
00366 
00367 const bool IOMux::ReleaseOutputDevice(const STREAM_TYPE E_StreamType, const bool B_Delete)
00368 {
00369     bool b_Res = true;
00370 
00371     if (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != NULL)
00372     {
00373         if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00374         {
00375             // Close the device if needed.
00376             if (! m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType]->CloseDown(__CALL_INFO__))
00377             {
00378                 b_Res = false;
00379             }
00380         }
00381         // Release the device instance.
00382         m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType]->FreeInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00383 
00384         // Remove reference.
00385         m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] = NULL;
00386     }
00387 
00388     return b_Res;
00389 }
